sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
Sure, here's a problem:

Solve the following system of linear equations using Cramer's rule:

2x + y - z = 5 

x - 3y + 2z = 8 

3x + 2y - 4z = -1
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix, which we'll call D. The coefficient matrix is:

| 2  1 -1 |
| 1 -3  2 |
| 3  2 -4 |

D = 2((-3)(-4) - 2(2)) - 1(1(-4) - 2(3)) + (-1)(1(2) - 3(-3))
D = 2(12 - 4) - 1(-4 - 6) + (-1)(2 + 9)
D = 2(8) + 1(10) - 11
D = 16 + 10 - 11
D = 15

Now we need to find the determinants of the matrices where we replace the columns with the constants from the right side of the equations. We'll call these determinants Dx, Dy, and Dz.

For Dx, replace the first column with the constants (5, 8, -1):

| 5  1 -1 |
| 8 -3  2 |
| -1  2 -4 |

Dx = 5((-3)(-4) - 2(2)) - 1(8(-4) - 2(-1)) + (-1)(8(2) - (-3)(-1))
Dx = 5(12 - 4) - 1(-32 + 2) + (-1)(16 - 3)
Dx = 5(8) + 1(-30) - 13
Dx = 40 - 30 - 13
Dx = -3

For Dy, replace the second column with the constants (5, 8, -1):

| 2  5 -1 |
| 1  8  2 |
| 3 -1 -4 |

Dy = 2(8(-4) - 2(-1)) - 5(1(-4) - 2(3)) + (-1)(1(-1) - 3(-3))
Dy = 2(-32 + 2) - 5(-4 - 6) + (-1)(1 + 9)
Dy = 2(-30) + 5(10) - 10
Dy = -60 + 50 - 10
Dy = -20

For Dz, replace the third column with the constants (5, 8, -1):

| 2  1  5 |
| 1 -3  8 |
| 3  2 -1 |

Dz = 2((-3)(-1) - 8(2)) - 1(1(-1) - 8(3)) + 5(1(2) - 3(-3))
Dz = 2(3 - 16) - 1(-1 - 24) + 5(2 + 9)
Dz = 2(-13) + 1(25) + 5(11)
Dz = -26 + 25 + 55
Dz = 54

Now we can find the values of x, y, and z by dividing Dx, Dy, and Dz by D:

x = Dx / D = -3 / 15 = -1/5
y = Dy / D = -20 / 15 = -4/3
z = Dz / D = 54 / 15 = 18/5

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = -1/5
y = -4/3
z = 18/5
